ARABIC: وَقِيلِهِۦ يَٰرَبِّ إِنَّ هَٰٓؤُلَآءِ قَوْمٌ لَّا يُؤْمِنُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: And as for his words, 'My Lord, these are people who have no iman!'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: And (the Prophet) will say: "O Lord, these are certainly a people who do not believe."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: We call to witness the cry of the Messenger: “O Lord, these are a people not wont to believe!”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: (God has knowledge of Muhammad's words when he complains to Him), "My Lord, these, my people, do not believe".
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And by oath of the saying of My Prophet “O my Lord! These people do not accept faith!”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And his saying: "O my Lord! Verily, these are a people who believe not!"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Consider his cry: O my Lord! surely they are a people who do not believe.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: And for his saying, 'My Lord, surely these are a people who believe not' --
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And he saith: O my Lord! Lo! these are a folk who believe not.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: The Prophet has said, "Lord! Truly they are a people who do not believe."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And We hear his saying: my Lord! verily these are a people who believe not.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: And his plaint: ‘My Lord! Indeed these are a people who will not have faith!’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: (Allah has knowledge) of the (Prophet's) cry, "O my Lord! Truly these are people who will not believe!"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: (Allah has knowledge) of (Prophet Muhammad's) saying: "O my Lord! Verily, these are a people who believe not!"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: And for his saying: 'My Lord, these are an unbelieving nation'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: As for his statement: “My Lord, these are a people who do not believe.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And [Allah acknowledges] his saying, "O my Lord, indeed these are a people who do not believe."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [43:88] And [as] for his saying: that is, the saying of the Prophet Muhammad (s) (wa-qīlihi is [accusative] dependent because it is a verbal noun followed by an implicit verb, in other words wa-qāla [qīlihi], ‘and he said [his saying]’) ‘O my Lord! These are indeed a people who have no faith’.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And he saith) Muhammad (pbuh) says: (0 my Lord! Lo! those are a folk who believe not) in You or in the Qur'an. So do with them as You will.
